extendedInfo.description: "Prague by house numbers" guide is designed for curious tourists who prefer to explore on their own and value their time even when on holiday."Prague by house numbers" means absolute freedom! No required routes or useless information! The Prague house numbers are the keys to unlocking their secrets.More than 700 of the most beautiful and most famous houses, palaces, churches, and monasteries in the historical centre of Prague (Castle District, Old and New Town, Lesser Town, and the Jewish Quarter) will disclose their secrets to visitors visiting the Czech Republic's capital city who speak one of the following 8 languages: Czech, English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Russian, or Japanese.!!! The demo version contains information about houses 211, 377 and 378 (StarÃ© MÄsto). You can activate the full version with PayPal.It's very simple:1. Find the red sign with the house number(*); on the faÃ§ade of the house which has grabbed your attention.2. Key in the house numbers and listen to the fascinating history of the building in your native language.(*) The red house number signs contain the name of the city (such as Praha1), the district (such as StarÃ© MÄsto) and the house number (such as 915).
